byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Lausanne, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington. David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Lausanne.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MATTHEW ROSENBERG

abstract: Talks over Iran's nuclear program become difficult as deadline for agreement nears; United States and its negotiating partners seek formal and detailed public document, while Iran wants statement of general understanding with detailed agreements to come later.
lead_paragraph: An initial accord will not be possible unless the Iranian leadership makes “tough decisions” before Tuesday’s deadline, a State Department official said.

headline.main: Hurdles Loom in Iran Nuclear Talks, U.S. Official Says
headline.print_headline: Hurdles Loom in Iran Nuclear Talks, U.S. Official Says

snippet: An initial accord will not be possible unless the Iranian leadership makes “tough decisions” before Tuesday’s deadline, a State Department official said.
